title: Memorials of Edinburgh in the olden time
author: Wilson, Daniel
snippet: The Palace of the Bishops of Dunkeld, and of Gawin Douglas in particular, the friendly opponent of the Archbishop, stood on the opposite side of the same street, immediately to the west of Robertson's Close, and scarcely an hundred yards from Blackfriars' Wynd.2 It appears to have been an extensive mansion, with large gardens attached to it, running back nearly to the Old Town Wall.
